intro: Sisymbrium scorpiurus, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features pinnately divided leaves. Its flowers are usually bright yellow, and they open in the morning, closing by midday. Sisymbrium scorpiurus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
